results.title: Silk stockings
results.creator_credit: Rouben Mamoulian, Arthur Freed, Arthur Freed Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In this exuberant song and dance remake of Lubitsch’s ‘Ninotchka’, Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse team up as the leading couple. Ninotchka, a stern lady Communist (Charisse) comes to Paris to retrieve three wayward comrades (Peter Lorre, Jules Munshin, Joseph Buloff) and a Russian composer (George Tobias). Much to her surprise, she is seduced by the trappings of capitalism in the form of champagne, silk stockings and a suave American producer (Fred Astaire), all of which contradict her Communist sensibilities. Includes songs such as: “Fated to be mated”, “All of you”, “The Ritz Rock and Roll”, “Silk stockings”, “Red blues”, “Josephine” and “Stereophonic sound”. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. Screenplay by Leonard Gershe and Leonard Spigelgass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rouben Mamoulian, Arthur Freed, Arthur Freed Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Since I Left You – The Avalanches
results.brief_description: Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling, The Avalanches’ ‘Since I Left You’ manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.

constellations_primary.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_primary.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.description: It seems fitting that for a band with such an unusual musical reputation like The Avalanches, the accompanying visuals to ‘Since I Left You’ would be so unique as well. Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling from the Blue Source art collective, it manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.
description_for_label: It seems fitting that for a band with such an unusual musical reputation like The Avalanches, the accompanying visuals to ‘Since I Left You’ would be so unique as well. results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Jamie Blanks and Hugh Burton
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.

results.title: An Interview with Joyce Bryan
results.brief_description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.

results.title: Sinatra: a passionate life
results.brief_description: Sinatra: A passionate life is a loving tribute to the late Frank Sinatra. It provides an excellent biographical overview of the singer, actor and all-round performer, ranging from his childhood years to retirement. We are introduced to Sinatra’s family, his place of birth, his admiration for Bing Crosby, his initial rise to fame, his huge success during World War II, his work in the film and TV industries, his Vegas years and experience with the Brat Pack, and so on. Interviews with numerous colleagues and close friends are interweaved with archival footage, photos and film excerpts. The archival footage is especially splendid including such rare and classic moments as Sinatra and Elvis Presley on live television performing each other’s songs or Dean Martin and Sammy Davis Jnr carrying out their legendary Brat Pack routines at the Sands casino in Las Vegas. Though completed just prior to Sinatra’s passing, “Sinatra: A passionate life” is overall both a fitting testament to the man’s unique talent, career achievements and influence and a record of the eras in which he performed.

results.title: The Yellow-box eucalypt
results.creator_credit: Des Surkitt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Des Surkitt pays tribute to the 27 fallen soldiers in one of the worst accidents in the Australian Army’s history. In Kapooka, an explosion during a training exercise, took the lives of all but one of the young soldiers. This event had a profound effect on Des, more so as he had just completed the training program the week before. Despite his good fortune, Des honours these lost men and reflects on why they have been forgotten by their own country.

results.title: Sin the movie (D)
results.creator_credit: Yasunori Urata, Andrew Orjuela and ADV Films
results.brief_description: Based on a popular video game, Sin the Movie is a compelling, action-packed tale set in Earth’s dystopic future. The city of Freeport has been rocked by a number of unexplained abductions involving a mutant humanoid. Colonel John Blade, leader of the elite strike force, Hardcorps, makes it his business to solve the mystery after one of his team is murdered by the monster. His efforts lead him to Sintek Industries, a multibillion dollar corporation headed by Elexis Sinclaire, brilliant biochemist and vicious vixen. When an adopted child, Elyse, is kidnapped, John and JC, the sister of his dead team-member, join forces to destroy the mutant, and stop Elexis from unleashing a genetically-engineered apocalypse upon the city. The director of this animation, Yasunori Urata, has been linked with a number of other important anime works, and is renowned for his stories, which combine human drama with spectacular action.

results.title: Silent movie
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Michael Hertzberg, Crossbow and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Only one word of dialogue, (spoken by Marcel Marceau), in this Mel Brooks satire. Brooks portrays a director who comes up with a radical idea to save an ailing movie studio. He and his cronies band together to make a silent movie. Filled with slapstick gags reminiscent of the original silent classics, “Silent movie” features cameo appearances from a star studded cast including Mel Brooks, Marty Feldman, Dom DeLuise, Sid Caesar and Bernadette Peters.

results.title: The Parachute workers
results.creator_credit: Peg Osborne, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being discouraged, Peg Osborne wanted to contribute to Australia’s World War II effort. She joined the air force and was sent to Bairnsdale as a textile worker. She reflects on her time there, the work, relations with the male workers, and the sorrows as well as the humour that keep everyone’s spirits up and the friends that Peg will never forget.

results.title: Simultaneous equations
results.brief_description: Examines simultaneous equations and inequations, and provides a basis for studying linear programming. Film No 2506. From the series “Vision in Mathematics”.
